info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 12:22PM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Louisville KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...Kentucky...
Ohio River at McAlpine Upper affecting Jefferson, Oldham, Clark and Floyd Counties.
Ohio River at McAlpine Lower affecting Jefferson, Harrison, Clark, Hardin, Floyd and Meade Counties.
Ohio River at Clifty Creek affecting Trimble and Jefferson Counties.
.Heavy rain from the past few days will cause the river to rise.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Ohio River at McAlpine Lower.
* WHEN...From Saturday afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 65.0 feet, Parts of US 31W (Dixie Highway) flood from I-265 (Gene Synder Freeway) interchange to West Point KY. Riverfront parks in Clarksville and New Albany flood. At 66.0 feet, Lock is closed. Floodgates at Riverport are closed. At 67.0 feet, Blackiston Mill Road floods at Silver Creek in Clarksville.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM EDT Friday the stage was 42.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 45.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 68.0 feet early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 55.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 68.0 feet on 04/18/1948. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon at 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Clark, IN; Floyd, IN; Harrison, IN; Hardin, KY; Jefferson, KY; Meade, KY
